intro: Adenostemma hirtiflorum, commonly known as hairy-flowered adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and covered with fine pubescence. The flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are arranged in spikes, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
